theologicalCoherenceMapping.progression: Foundation Questions → Human Definition → Systematic Theology → Scientific Validation → Environmental Dynamics → Mystical Culmination

crossBatchIntegration.fiṭrah: Evolved from basic concept (batch 1) to comprehensive theology (batch 4)
crossBatchIntegration.nafs: Soul states unified with environmental interaction patterns
crossBatchIntegration.rūḥ: Spiritual aspect integrated with light metaphysics
crossBatchIntegration.qalb: Heart-mind dynamics culminate in mystical receptivity

foundationalQuestions.original: لنبدئ بحثنا بالسؤال هل الحضارة هي ناتج فطري انساني موحد عند كل البشر؟
foundationalQuestions.enhanced: لنبدئ بحثنا بالسؤال هل الحضارة هي ناتج فطري انساني موحد عند كل البشر؟
foundationalQuestions.english: Let us begin our investigation with the question: Is civilization a unified primordial (*fiṭrī*) human product present in all people?

foundationalQuestions.original: أم أن الإنسانية هي التي تؤثر بالمحيط وتصنعه وتصيغ شكله وطبعه بما يتلاءم وينسجم مع فطرتها وإنسانيتها؟
foundationalQuestions.enhanced: أم أن الإنسانية هي التي تؤثر بالمحيط وتصنعه وتصيغ شكله وطبعه بما يتلاءم وينسجم مع فطرتها وإنسانيتها؟
foundationalQuestions.english: Or is it humanity that influences its environment, fashions it, and shapes its form and character in a way that harmonizes and aligns with its *fiṭrah* and essential humanity?

systematicTheology.original: الفطرة: هي التكوين الذي يكون الله الإنسان عليه، قال الله تعالى: "فطرة الله التي فطر الناس عليها لا تبديل لخلق الله ذلك الدين القيم"
systematicTheology.enhanced: الفطرة: هي التكوين الذي يكون الله الإنسان عليه، قال الله تعالى: "فطرة الله التي فطر الناس عليها لا تبديل لخلق الله ذلك الدين القيم"
systematicTheology.english: *Fiṭrah*: It is the constitution upon which God created the human being. God the Exalted says: "فطرة الله التي فطر الناس عليها لا تبديل لخلق الله ذلك الدين القيم" (*fiṭrat Allāh allatī faṭara al-nās ʿalayhā lā tabdīl li-khalq Allāh dhālik al-dīn al-qayyim*)[^7]

crossBatchIntegration.1: *Fiṭrah* — the innate, primordial nature with which God created humanity [FOUNDATIONAL - Batch 1]
crossBatchIntegration.2: *Nafs* — the soul or psyche; distinct from *rūḥ* (spirit) in Islamic psychology [ESTABLISHED - Batch 2]
crossBatchIntegration.3: *Rūḥāniyyīn* — spiritual beings, incorporeal entities including angels and jinn [ESTABLISHED - Batch 2]
crossBatchIntegration.4: *Ra's* — the head, representing rational/sensory faculties in Islamic psychology [ESTABLISHED - Batch 3]
crossBatchIntegration.5: *Dunyawiyyah* — worldly, pertaining to this temporal life (*dunyā*) [ESTABLISHED - Batch 3]
crossBatchIntegration.6: *Ākhirah* — the Hereafter, the eternal life after death [ESTABLISHED - Batch 3]

newBatch4Terms.7: Quran 30:30 — 'God's *fiṭrah* upon which He created mankind; there is no altering God's creation. That is the right religion.' — M.A.S. Abdel Haleem
newBatch4Terms.8: *Fiṭrī* — primordial, relating to the innate nature (*fiṭrah*)
newBatch4Terms.9: *Al-gharbal al-fiṭrī* — the primordial sieve, filtering mechanism of innate nature
newBatch4Terms.10: *Al-mishkāh* — the divine niche, from the Light Verse (Quran 24:35)

majorCitations.arabic: فطرة الله التي فطر الناس عليها لا تبديل لخلق الله ذلك الدين القيم
